messages.subject: Earth day
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4/22/02 3:14:55 PM Central Daylight Time, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/22/02 3:14:55 PM Central Daylight Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< He said, "Oh, that means it's Earth Day today. What does Earth Day mean?"
I told him it's a day about remembering to keep the earth alive and healthy
and growing, planting things, etc.
And he said "Well, shouldn't you do that every day?"
I said, "yeah, you're right! We *should* do that every day."
LOL! I thought it was funny. :o)
>>

One of the other unschoolers was just saying last week that Earth Day really
irked her because we should be conscious of caring for the Earth every day!!!
How true.
Tell him it's to bring awareness to people that might not be thinking about
it every day, that's the only explanation I could come up with .....??
Ren
